alert.note: Alert for Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 5:51PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cherry and central Sheridan Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 451 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 23 miles southeast of Rushville, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gordon, Rushville, Merriman, White Clay, Clinton, Intersection of Highway 87 and Craven Creek Road, Big Hill, Billys Lake, Lone Butte, Irwin, Intersection of Highway 87 and Larabee Road, Rock Hill, Pine Ridge, Hoover Lake, Morgan Lake, Highway 27 crossing the Niobrara River, Smith Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Mount Maria, Intersection of Highway 20 and Irwin Road and Highway 250 crossing the Niobrara River. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 82 and 137. Highway 250 between mile markers 21 and 48. Highway 61 between mile markers 224 and 230. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
